32760956.review: More of a puzzle game that uses the match 3 idea to clear pieces. Move along empty ground to match up and remove birds of the same color or enemy cats (only two birds are required to remove a cat in the center). Free or find hidden keys which are then used to unlock chicks. Absurdly simple idea with more sophisticated rules thrown in as you progress. Great execution, cute humor, AND definitely worth the purchase.

30143202.review:
I wasn't sure about this game, as there were not many reviews, but I [i]am[/i] glad I bought it.
This is not a "match 3" game, it is a puzzle game, through and through. Each level seems lovingly crafted with a lot of thought going into the design, what one must do to solve the level will change from level to level, so playing it is always fresh.
I will not try to explain the mechanics of the game, as I am not a good enough writer to do it justice, I'll just say: I'm having fun with this one and find myself still thinking about it when I have to go back to my chores.

28549224.review:
First impression: decent casual puzzle game with lots of levels.

It works a lot like [i]Hexus[/i]: if you make empty moves that don't lead to a combination, some empty spaces turn into eggs and the existing eggs turn into birds, cluttering up the playing field (or providing welcome reinforcements). Some of the bonuses are timed. Since this is only a first impression and I haven't played it all that much, so obviously I don't know how difficult the game is going to get, but this being a casual game, I don't really expect more than medium difficulty.

The game delivers what you'd expect, no surprises, but it's not as outstanding as the 100% recommendations might lead you to believe.  It runs in a window and works on older computers, too.

There's a sequel.

26348586.review:
Claws & Feathers reminds me Angry Birds, but the game play is different

Cute matching game

It's definitely a worth to try

22349924.review:
+ Unique, solid mechanics.
+ Good variety in level design.

- Randomization makes some goals impossible or just tedious if you don't get the pieces you need.
- Soundtrack's kind of annoying.

Definitely recommended for match 3 fans.

18636003.review:
A pretty solid puzzle game in the match-3 vein, where the basic mechanics remain the same from level to level, but each stage can be a chain of puzzles to solve to get to the goal, or just board-control where you need to keep clear paths as new pieces spawn, or even "make a path to the one key to open the goal". It's varied and while it might use similar versions of an objective, they don't repeat and the boards are shaped around new experiences. If you want to go above and beyond the usual, every stage has a "golden egg" challenge to meet as well, and it kept this challenging even for my skills with the genre, especially by the end of the game.

Overall a fantastic title unless you've got some kind of revulsion to Looney Tunes "violence" (bombs turning cartoon animals to ash and eyeballs, etc) or the genre itself.

Иными словами, вместо фигурок тут птички и котики, которые очень даже враждуют. И вроде бы это противостояние должно было быть веселым (в теории да), но как паззл игра скучна. До настоящих жемчужин жанра (EG: Heroes of Kalevala, Puzzle Quest 2 и т.д.) очень сильно не дотягивает, аудиторию игры представляю себе с трудом, т.к. для аналогичной игры "Индикот" каждый месяц выходит новый контент, например.

15140812.review:
Claws & Feathers is a casual match 3 puzzle game with some funky and well thought out game play mechanics twists.

The game starts off simple gradually introducing new play mechanics as the game progresses.  Complexity is added by custom rules and restrictions applied to certain levels.  The game is easy to get into and the levels are interesting and progressively more difficult or complex.

Graphics are in full HD (1920 x 1080) and are in a cartoon or children's story book type style.

Sounds are atmospheric and the music soundtrack is laid back and has elements of jazz and big band era infuence.  The music is relaxing and non-intrusive which compliments the puzzle solving nature of the game.

Players will have their hands full rescueing birds, dispensing with al capone kitties and cat burglers, finding keys to unlock cages, bombing walls and barriers, and trying to prevent the screen overpopulating from hatching eggs!  A few of the levels are time attack levels while most of the later levels have specific restrictive victory conditions.  The background and game board will change every few levels to fit a new themed area with rooftiles giving way to lawn and flowerbeds complete with mowers and garden gnomes.

Claws & Feathers is a family friendly game which will appeal to players of all ages.  Add to this that the game is really fun to play.  The small download size means this game will be well suited to the casual gamer with limited disk space.

The menu is intuitive and the controls and interface are are easy to use.  The game delivers well on all fronts.

For your money you get a fantastic time-waster with cute graphics, good sound, lots of fun and plenty of re-playability.

8.0 / 10

15104672.review:
My FIrst Impressions Video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BFNX_ZqcNhw

This game is a beautiful puzzler game in the same realm of games as the ultra popular matching games like Bejeweled and Candy Crush.

The beauty of this game is that each new level throws a new objective at you with different rules such as beat the level within a certain taimeframe, or without matching so many red birds, or in under a certain amounf of moves, etc.

It also adds in humor and the whole 'cute' factor with birds, baby chicklets, and cats who are the natural hunters of the birds.  

This game gets more challenging quick then both Bejeweled and Candy Crush however, and will definitely workout your wits.  

A rare "must buy" rating in my video for any puzzle game fans who enjoy games such as Bejeweled and/or Candy Crush.  The price (regular price $6.99 USD) is about half of what I would expect to pay for a game like this, which helped my decision to rate this very fun and addicting little game a "must buy".

My Overall Rating:  9 out of 10


Enjoy!

15078158.review: A wonderful game to relax to. It is charming and a lot of fun to play. It is a complicated yet simple puzzle game where you need to match 3 birds of the same color to each other. You need to make sure you plan out your moves because the birds have laid eggs which will hatch to block your path to the other birds. You need to plan your route and try to avoid the obstacles in your way. Its great fun and great for casual players to hardcore gamers that want to get the highest score within the time limits of the levels . Highly Recommended!

15074640.review:
Fun little level based puzzle game that's a bit of a different take on Match 3.

The premise may sound familiar, some birds are angry that their friends are kidnapped, this time by cats. Don't expect a physics game though. This is a straight puzzle game that plays closer to a match 3 though significantly different, and I would say more complex, than something like Bejeweled.

The staple of the gameplay is to remove birds of the same color from the playing field, a roof, by aligning three of the same color. You can do this in a row or in an L shaped corner. The trick is that a bird can only move where there's an open path, so no obstacles like another bird blocking it, and if you move a bird without making a 3 or more group match then more birds will show up on the playing field adding more obstacles. There are little eggs of different colors showing where the new birds will 'hatch' and sometimes you actually want to make a move that's not a match in order to get a bird of a particular color to appear so there's a bit of strategy to it all.

Other additions are made to the gameplay such as this cats, the 'Claws' part of the game, who you must surround on either side to fly them off the playing field, birds who are chained up and need a match to be released and hidden keys.

Note that some of the levels are timed as well but not all. Each level has different requirements so there's a lot of variety and you never quite know what to expect. I liked the unpredictability that you had other goals to meet besides simply rescuing the birds that varied with each level.

I was a bit apprehensive of the timed levels at first since I prefer to play puzzle and casual strategy games at a slower pace where I have more time to think out my moves but after a few tries I was able to get through them without much problem. It forced me to play in a bit of a different way for those levels which again I found to be a nice variety.

As with most level based casual games this is one where you don't need to make a huge time commitment and can play a level or two here and there in short bursts.

From a technical standpoint the visuals were all done well, looked great in full screen. I experienced no bugs errors or technical issues.

If you're looking for a puzzle game that's a little bit different and more complex than a simple match 3 and you like variety I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Claws and Feathers.

15073918.review:
This game might have an angry birds vibe to it, but its a whole lot more.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rgevgtr59Rw
Get ready for the fur to fly in this wild and crazy matching game! A flock of friendly birds is out for revenge after a gang of cats led by a portly feline with a weakness for hamburgers steals their chicks.Match clusters of birds to clear a path to the hatchlings and reclaim what belongs to your finely feathered friends. - Recommended!

15071095.review:
Claws & Feathers:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 

Claws & feathers is a puzzle game setup like a grid. The aim of the game is to be the good chook by saving all the poor little chicks trapped in cages.

You will have to match at least 3 chickens of the same colour to make them fly off the grid but if you do not succeed coloured eggs will hatch and more birds will appear on the board. Place your chickens strategically to grab menacing cats and fly them off the grid. Every time you remove a cat from the board items will be revealed, such as keys or bombs. Keys will unlock the cages to free your beautiful chicks and see them flying gracefully to their nest. Bombs will explode to remove obstacles such as walls. Calculate your move carefully so you do not overpopulate the board with chickens thereby freezing your next move.  
 
From time to time, you will have several objectives to achieve within a level. This can be tricky; you might need to unchain all chickens, remove walls and if you are lucky you may even have to beat the clock! They are plenty of variations per level, which is exactly what you want for this type of game. Succeed and you will be rewarded with a golden egg! 

Claws and Feathers will appeal to all gamers for hours and will definitely keep you well entertained.

Graphics and soundtrack are good and the game runs very well! In a nutshell, it is a lot of fun.

Positive:
~~~~~~~  

-	Good puzzle game
-	Plenty of variations per level
-	Nice graphics and soundtrack   
-	Achievements
-	Trading cards

Negative:
~~~~~~~~  

-	Beat the clock levels are quiet hard and might be frustrating

A good game to have in your library.

8/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

15066309.review:
Claws & Feathers is the perfect example of appearances that can be deceiving. Bright, fluffy birdies and cute kitties feature in this game, which at first glance looks like a really easy and casual match-3 type game. A few levels in and the fur and feathers are flying (figuratively and sometimes literally) as you try to maneuver your pieces around the board while thinking multiple moves ahead like some master chess strategist.

In the game, your chicks are trapped in locked cages and you must free them. To accomplish this, you move birds around the game board, matching 3 of the same color in order to clear some of the birds off by letting them take flight. The idea is to clear paths on the game board between golden keys and the locked cages. Making all of this much more difficult is the fact that every move causes eggs to appear and more birds to hatch. Sometimes you might clear some part of the board just to block other parts on the same move, a bit like taking a step forward while also sliding backwards. This definitely forces you to think several moves ahead as you play. Additional game mechanics, like cats and bombs, can further hinder or help your progress as you try to clear obstacles blocking the way.

Don't be fooled by the cute, Claws & Feathers gets hard fast. The timed missions are particularly difficult, and I found just completing those levels a challenge. Solving the conditions of each puzzle board is going to take multiple repeats, and I honestly found the game a little frustrating at times.

However, if you're looking for a challenging strategy puzzle game masquerading as a casual match-3 timespinner, you will find it in Claws & Feathers. 

[i]A review copy of this game was provided by the publisher.[/i]

When I saw this game for the first time I thought that this is something like Angry Birds but with cats instead of pigs. But no, this is another type of casual game - match 3 game.
To be honest I'm not a big fan of such games, especially on PC. In my opinion this is good game to play on smartphone. So I played it on my Win 8 tablet. And to be honest this is biggest advantage of this game, because on Steam there are not many games working well using touchscreen only. This game is one of them and in my opinion this is the best way to play it.
But to be honest I didn't enjoy it, so this is next time I wish there was neutral opinion here. But I prefer to give positive because it's solid piece of code. It works well, I didn't experience any bugs, graphics and music are nice and there are some fresh ideas in that genre. Nothing revolutionary, but it might be enjoying for fans of such games.

VERDICT:
If you're a casual gamer, you shoulf try it, especially if you like match 3 games.
If you don't like casual games, keep looking, this one won't change it.

15060980.review:
Claws & Feathers is another addictive and challenging puzzle game from Alawar Entertainment.  A fusion of Match 3 and puzzle fair, the gameplay is pretty unique and fun.  And despite looking a bit like Angry Birds in the art department, it is anything but.
  
Birds are striking back after a gang of nasty cats stole their eggs, but rescuing their offspring may be trickier than they thought!  The gameplay is more complex than it first appears.  We're given a game board with birds and cats sprinkled about.  Matching 3 of the same colored bird will remove them from the board, and to remove the cats and reveal the keys they're hiding you need to surround them with birds of the same color.  This is easier said than done as any move that does not result in a match adds colored eggs to the board.  An additional non-match move and the eggs hatch into full birds which will quite often block your path.   Too many bad moves, and you run the risk of getting blocked in and not being able to complete the stage.  Planning your strategy and working out the best series of moves is required to get through the game.  

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=414264314
Each stage has an objective that must be completed in order to earn a gold egg.  While failure doesn't prevent you from progressing on to the next stage (as long as you free the required number of chicks), the gold objective adds an extra layer of strategy to a lot of the game boards and helps bulk up play time as you'll often have to replay levels multiple times to earn gold.  This is something I really enjoy about a lot of these casual games; while you can certainly play them more casually, goals that encourage challenging yourself opens the game to even the not-so-casual crowd.   The difficulty ramps up pretty quickly too, so don't think it'll be easy sailing getting gold eggs on all stages, even the earlier ones will have you stumped and replaying multiple times. As you get further into the game, additional mechanics (bombs, chained birds, fireworks) introduce even more complexity to the level designs, mixing things up and keeping gameplay interesting and challenging.   Some stages are pretty dang clever, too.

The nice thing is that outside of a handful of stages with timed gold objectives, you can take as much time as you like to complete each.  So if you need to study the game board for a few minutes to plan out your moves, there's no ticking clock to worry about, it's just you and the birds.  This is great for those looking for less hectic "casual" gameplay  but also works well for the times you can't dedicate your full attention to a game.  My only complaint is that the timed levels can be rather hectic and stressful, the later ones taking dozens of tries to perfect, but this is only one small gripe for a game that is a ton of fun otherwise.

The presentation is top notch, as well.  I don't know why, but the sound effects are one of my favorite parts of the game; I just love the chirps the birds make as they fly off, it's so silly and cute.  The music is also great, reminding me of classic cartoons with their jazzy and lighthearted scores. Graphics aren't anything fancy, but cute and fitting for the type of game this is.  And really, who doesn't like a mustachioed bird?

With 56 levels and 30 achievements, there's quite a bit to play through.  Progress tracking on the achievements is a much appreciated addition, but they could definitely use Steam Integration.  At least it has trading cards to help sweeten the deal.  Although it took a bit to get the hang of the mechanics, I'm now squarely hooked on these birds.  There's just something about those trickier levels that makes you feel awesome once you finally snag gold.  Claws & Feathers is definitely worth a look if you're searching for a good puzzler without (for the most part) the craziness of time crunch games. 

Bottom Line: Recommended for strategy game enthusiasts and anyone needing to scratch that puzzle game itch. 

[h1]Note - This game was provided by the publisher with the request to write an informative review.[/h1]
